info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 08 at 9:38PM EDT until September 08 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE AND NORTHEASTERN ALBEMARLE COUNTIES... At 937 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Charlottesville to near Boswells Tavern to near Ferncliff, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management has reported numerous calls of downed trees in Albemarle County east of Charlottesville. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Orange, Campbell, Gordonsville, Cobham, Cismont, Eheart, Barboursville, Keswick, Stony Point, Montpelier Station, Madison Run, Shadwell, Thornhill, Old Somerset, and Somerset. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing widespread wind damage across eastern Albemarle County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
